channel.title: [WIP][C4D] Animationnnnn
channel.description:
Yeah so I haven't done anything GFXwise in a while, I've been so busy. So I was just playing around with the it, and got a basic idea for something.
After putting it all together I rendered it and it finished overnight surprisingly.
Feedback is VERY appreciated. This is a WIP, nothing is textured, and render settings were low, so expect a better one after I get feedback.
http://youtube.com/watch?v=IcgtA-e6Jvs
UPDATE: http://youtube.com/watch?v=rzc4MKuWcvo

item.title: [WIP][C4D] Animationnnnn
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Thanks guys =]
yeah the rendering w/ textures will be a muchh longer work.

Each frame only took an incredible 1-2 minutes.

With textures, well the ones I plan on using, will bump that up to anywhere from 10 - 1hr long frames.

But yeah, the reason why my things are watery/particle based, is because I experiment a lot with RealFlow, a particle simulator.

I’m not really fond of still images anymore, and I like animations. With this I can make animations.

I’m also learning boning characters, so I can animate them easier.

I think I’m fairly skilled in C4D, much more than any other app, because I’ve worked with it more.
But I can still make the things I make, in any other program, just not as time-efficiently.

I have 3DS Max, Maya, Modo, Rhino, RealFlow, Endorphin, and Boujou 3.

All of these I use either FinalRender, Maxwell, or Pixar Renderman with.
All of the works you see though, are FinalRender/C4D.

I’m still looking for a college that will be CG based, as I’m really interested, and I’ll be going in 1.5 years O_O[br][size=1]Posted on: January 31, 2007, 06:20:04 PM[/size][hr]
Sorry for the double post.

I’ve updated it a little.

Just trying out some materials.
&I didn’t like how fast the camera was in the other one, so I redid that too.

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP][C4D] Animationnnnn
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Nice job. You’re really good at making water and stuff, I remember another one of your animations had water like that. Well I guess C4D probably has some options to make it slightly easier, but that’s still awesome. I’m looking forward to seeing the end result.

I really need to get back into 3D modelling. I was pretty heavily into it for a little while when I formatted I never bothered downloading any programs. I was learning Maya, because the college I’ll be going to semi-soon teaches Maya and I wanted a head start, but I really don’t care for it.

Read full topic
